column19: Generally accepted value in 1600s in Jam
> 21 Dec / by Order of Gov of Jam, de jure rate fixed at Sp silver $ 1 = 0.5.0 Sterl
1672 < change fm 0.4.0 to 0.5.0 < 1680 / so set at midpoint
> 23 Feb / by Act / de jure rate Sp silver $ 1 = 0.5.0 Sterl
WI inc Jam put on gold std by Queen Anne on 18 Jun 1704
1707 < change from 5s to 6s 3p < 1722 / so set at midpoint
> 11 Nov / by Act, legally set at Sp silver $ 1 = 6s 8d

column19: > 23 Mar / by Order of HM, introduced British silver to WI
1s Sterling = 1s 8d currency by convention made official by Act 15 Nov
Sp. silver dollar set at 0.4.2 on 7 Sep for all WI /v Martin 25 [Appendix I]

column11: > 21 Jun / by Proclam of Sup / de facto $1 = 4s

column19: > 31 Dec / by Act, Jamaica currency = Sterling
Amt. of Sp. silver dollars greatly diminishes in Jam /v Chalmers 112

Panic of 1873 / silver value plummets / US + Europe move to gold std

column19: Sp. silver dollar demonetised by Act /v Chalmers 113

Possibly = market rather than Treasury rate
